intro: Euadenia eminens, commonly known as the tall euadenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, hairy texture. Euadenia eminens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or along stream banks.
